title: Authors and Citation
text: Araya-Salas, M., Arriaga, . (2023), sketchy: research compendiums data analysis R. R package version 1.0.3.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sketchy: research compendiums for data analysis in R},   author = {M. Araya-Salas and A.Y. Arriaga},   year = {2023}, }

title: Create Custom Research Compendiums
text: package intended facilitate use research compendiums data analysis R environment. Standard research compendiums provide easily recognizable means organizing digital materials, allowing researchers inspect, reproduce, build upon research. Unlike R packages creating research compendiums (e.g. vertical, rrtools), sketchy isn’t wedded particular folder structure. Currently package provides 14 alternative structures (see object compendiums) allows users modify input structures. install latest developmental version github need R package remotes:

title: Create Custom Research Compendiums
text: Compendiums can set function make_compendium(). function creates folder/subfolder structure prints diagram skeleton console:

title: Create Custom Research Compendiums
text: (examples compendiums created temporary directory, change ‘path’ create different directory)
code: path = tempdir()  # load data data(compendiums)  make_compendium(name = "proyect_x", path = path, format = "basic") ## Creating directories ... ## proyect_x ## │    ## ├── data/   ## │   ├── processed/  # modified/rearranged data ## │   └── raw/  # original data ## ├── manuscript/  # manuscript/poster figures ## ├── output/  # all non-data products of data analysis ## └── scripts/  # code ## Done.

title: Create Custom Research Compendiums
text: can use folder structures sources. instance, example use structured suggested Wilson et al. (2017):   creating compendium includes “manuscript” folder package adds “manuscript_template.Rmd” file facilitating paper writing within compendium . can check compendium structure available follows: Please cite sketchy follows: Araya-Salas, M., Willink, B., Arriaga, . (2020), sketchy: research compendiums data analysis R. R package version 1.0.0.
code: make_compendium(name = "proyect_z", path = path, format = "large_compendium") ## Creating directories ... ## proyect_z ## │    ## ├── analysis/  # Data, scripts, RMarkdown reports and Makefile ## │   ├── data/  # Raw data in open formats, not changed once created ## │   └── scripts/  # R code used to analyse and visualise data ## ├── man/  # Auto-generated documentation for the custom R functions ## ├── R/  # Custom R functions used repeatedly throughout the project ## └── tests/  # Unit tests of R functions to ensure they perform as expected ## Done. for (i in 1:length(compendiums)) {     print("---------------", quote = FALSE)     print(names(compendiums)[i], quote = FALSE)     print_skeleton(folders = compendiums[[i]]$skeleton) } ## [1] --------------- ## [1] basic ## . ## │    ## ├── data/   ## │   ├── processed/   ## │   └── raw/   ## ├── manuscript/   ## ├── output/   ## └── scripts/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] figures ## . ## │    ## ├── data/   ## │   ├── processed/   ## │   └── raw/   ## ├── manuscript/   ## ├── output/   ## │   └── figures/   ## │       ├── exploratory/   ## │       └── final/   ## └── scripts/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] project_template ## . ## │    ## ├── cache/   ## ├── config/   ## ├── data/   ## ├── diagnostics/   ## ├── docs/   ## ├── graphs/   ## ├── lib/   ## ├── logs/   ## ├── munge/   ## ├── profiling/   ## ├── reports/   ## ├── src/   ## └── tests/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] pakillo ## . ## │    ## ├── analyses/   ## ├── data/   ## ├── data-raw/   ## ├── docs/   ## ├── inst/   ## ├── man/   ## ├── manuscript/   ## ├── R/   ## └── tests/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] boettiger ## . ## │    ## ├── man/   ## ├── R/   ## ├── tests/   ## └── vignettes/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] wilson ## . ## │    ## ├── data/   ## ├── doc/   ## ├── requirements/   ## ├── results/   ## └── src/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] small_compendium ## . ## │    ## ├── analysis/   ## └── data/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] medium_compendium ## . ## │    ## ├── analysis/   ## ├── data/   ## ├── man/   ## └── R/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] large_compendium ## . ## │    ## ├── analysis/   ## │   ├── data/   ## │   └── scripts/   ## ├── man/   ## ├── R/   ## └── tests/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] vertical ## . ## │    ## ├── data/   ## ├── data-raw/   ## ├── docs/   ## ├── experiments/   ## ├── man/   ## ├── manuscripts/   ## ├── model/   ## ├── posters/   ## ├── R/   ## ├── slides/   ## └── vignettes/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] rrtools ## . ## │    ## ├── analysis/   ## ├── data/   ## ├── figures/   ## ├── paper/   ## └── templates/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] rdir ## . ## │    ## ├── code/   ## │   ├── processed/   ## │   └── raw/   ## ├── data/   ## │   ├── clean/   ## │   └── raw/   ## ├── figures/   ## │   ├── exploratory/   ## │   └── final/   ## └── text/   ##     ├── final/   ##     └── notes/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] workflowr ## . ## │    ## ├── analysis/   ## ├── code/   ## ├── data/   ## ├── docs/   ## └── output/   ## [1] --------------- ## [1] sketchy ## . ## │    ## ├── data/   ## │   ├── processed/   ## │   └── raw/   ## ├── manuscript/   ## ├── output/   ## └── scripts/

title: Create Custom Research Compendiums
text: Alston, J., & Rick, J. (2020). Beginner’s Guide Conducting Reproducible Research. Marwick, B., Boettiger, C., & Mullen, L. (2018). Packaging Data Analytical Work Reproducibly Using R (Friends). American Statistician, 72(1), 80–88. Wilson G, Bryan J, Cranston K, Kitzes J, Nederbragt L. & Teal, T. K.. 2017. Good enough practices scientific computing. PLOS Computational Biology 13(6): e1005510.

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
text: add_to_gitignore adds entries gitignore based file extension file size

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
code: add_to_gitignore(add.to.gitignore = FALSE, cutoff = NULL, extension = NULL, path = ".")

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
text: add..gitignore Logical control files added 'gitignore' just printed console. cutoff Numeric. Defines file size (MB) cutoff used find files (.e. files threshold returned). 99 (MB) recommended hosting projects github current file size limit 100 MB. extension Character string define file extension files searched . path Path project directory. Default current directory.

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
text: Prints name files matching searching parameters. add..ignore = TRUE files matching search parameters ('cutoff' /'extension') added 'gitignore' (file used git exclude files form version control, including adding github).

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
text: function can used avoid conflicts working large files just avoid adding non-binary files remote repositories. mostly aims simplify spotting/excluding large files. Note file names can manually added '.gitignore' file using text editor.

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
text: Araya-Salas, M., Arriaga, . (2023), sketchy: research compendiums data analysis R. R package version 1.0.3.

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
text: Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)

title: Add entries to gitignore — add_to_gitignore
code: { data(compendiums)  make_compendium(name = "my_compendium", path = tempdir(),  format = "basic", force = TRUE)  # save a file write.csv(iris, file.path(tempdir(), "my_compendium", "iris.csv"))  # add the file to gitignore add_to_gitignore(add.to.gitignore = TRUE, path = file.path(tempdir(), "my_compendium"), extension = "csv") } #> Creating directories ... #> my_compendium #> │    #> ├── data/   #> │   ├── processed/  # modified/rearranged data #> │   └── raw/  # original data #> ├── manuscript/  # manuscript/poster figures #> ├── output/  # all non-data products of data analysis #> └── scripts/  # code #> Done. #> '.gitignore' file not found so it was created #> The following file(s) match(es) the extension and exceed(s) the cutoff: #> iris.csv #>  #> File(s) added to '.gitignore': #> iris.csv

title: List with compendium skeletons — compendiums
text: compendiums list containing format 14  different project folder skeletons. format 3 elements provided: `$skeleton` (folder structure), `$comments` `$info` (reference original source).

title: List with compendium skeletons — compendiums
text: list 14 compendium formats: basic basic sketchy format figures similar basic, including output/figures folders project_template following Kenton White's ProjectTemplate pakillo following Francisco Rodriguez-Sanchez' template boettiger following Carl Boettiger's blog wilson following Wilson et al. (2017) format small_compendium following Marwick et al (2018) small compendium format medium_compendium following Marwick et al (2018) medium compendium format large_compendium following Marwick et al (2018) large compendium format vertical following Vuorre et al. (2018) R package vertical rrtools following Marwick (2018) (R package rrtools) rdir following folder structure described r-dir blog post (although seems like removed) workflowr following Blischak et al. (2019) R package workflowr sketchy skeleton 'basic' including custom Rmarkdown quarto files documenting data analyses

title: List with compendium skeletons — compendiums
text: Blischak, J. D., Carbonetto, P., & Stephens, M. 2019. Creating sharing reproducible research code workflowr way. F1000Research, 8. Marwick, B. 2018. rrtools: Creates reproducible research compendium. Marwick, B., Boettiger, C., & Mullen, L. 2018. Packaging data analytical work reproducibly using R (friends). American Statistician, 72(1), 80-88. Vuorre, Matti, Matthew J. C. Crump. 2020. Sharing Organizing Research Products R Packages. PsyArXiv. January 15. Wilson G, Bryan J, Cranston K, Kitzes J, Nederbragt L. & Teal, T. K.. 2017. Good enough practices scientific computing. PLOS Computational Biology 13(6): e1005510.

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
text: load_packages installs loads packages different repositories.

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
text: packages Character vector names packages installed. vector names indicate repositories packages installed. name included CRAN used default repository. Available repositories : 'cran', 'github', 'gitlab', 'bitbucket' 'bioconductor'. Note 'github', 'gitlab' 'bitbucket' string must include user name form 'user/package'. quite Logical argument control package startup messages printed. Default FALSE (messages printed). upgrade.deps Logical argument control package dependencies upgraded.Default FALSE.

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
text: object returned.

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
text: function installs loads packages different repositories single call.

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
text: Araya-Salas, M., Arriaga, . (2023), sketchy: research compendiums data analysis R. R package version 1.0.3.

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
text: Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)

title: Install and load packages — load_packages
code: if (FALSE) { load_packages(packages = c("kableExtra", bioconductor = "ggtree", github = "maRce10/Rraven"), quite = TRUE) }

what: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
text: make_compendium generates folder structure research compendium.

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
code: make_compendium(name = "research_compendium", path = ".", force = FALSE, format = "basic", packrat = FALSE, git = FALSE, clone = NULL, readme = TRUE, Rproj = FALSE)

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
text: name character string: research compendium directory name. special characters used. Default "research_compendium". path Path put project directory . Default current directory. force Logical controlling whether existing folders name used setting folder structure. function never overwrite existing files folders. format character vector length 1 name built-compendiums available example object `compendiums` (see compendiums available formats). Default 'basic'. Alternatively, can character vector 2 elements names folders subfolders included. packrat Logical control packrat initialized (packrat::init()) creating compendium. Default FALSE. git Logical control git repository initialized (git2r::init()) creating compendium. Default FALSE. clone Path directory containing folder structure cloned. Default NULL. provided 'format' ignored. Folders starting ^\.git|^\.Rproj.user|^\.\.Rcheck ignored. readme Logical. Controls readme file (Rmd format) added project. file predefined fields documenting objectives current status project. Default TRUE. Rproj Logical. TRUE R project created (.e. .Rproj file saved main project directory).

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
text: folder skeleton research compendium. addition structure compendium printed console. compendium format includes "manuscript" "doc(s)" folder function saves manuscript template Rmarkdown format ("manuscript.Rmd"), BibTex file ("example_library.bib", showing add citations) APA citation style file ("apa.csl") inside folder.

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
text: function takes predefined folder structures generate directory skeleton research compendium.

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
text: Araya-Salas, M., Arriaga, . (2023), sketchy: research compendiums data analysis R. R package version 1.0.3.Marwick, B., Boettiger, C., & Mullen, L. (2018). Packaging Data Analytical Work Reproducibly Using R (Friends). American Statistician, 72(1), 80-88.Alston, J., & Rick, J. (2020). Beginners Guide Conducting Reproducible Research.

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
text: Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)

title: Generate folder structures for research compendiums — make_compendium
code: { data(compendiums)  make_compendium(name = "mycompendium", path = tempdir(), format = "basic", force = TRUE) } #> Creating directories ... #> mycompendium #> │    #> ├── data/   #> │   ├── processed/  # modified/rearranged data #> │   └── raw/  # original data #> ├── manuscript/  # manuscript/poster figures #> ├── output/  # all non-data products of data analysis #> └── scripts/  # code #> Done. #>

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
text: print_skeleton prints folder structure research compendium.

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
text: path path directory printed. Default current directory. comments character string comments added folder graphical representation folder skeleton printed console. folders character vector including name sub-directories project.

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
text: folder skeleton printed console.

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
text: function prints folder structure existing project.

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
text: Araya-Salas, M., Arriaga, . (2023), sketchy: research compendiums data analysis R. R package version 1.0.3.

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
text: Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)

title: Print folder structures — print_skeleton
code: { data(compendiums)  make_compendium(name = "my_other_compendium", path = tempdir(), format = "basic")  print_skeleton(path = file.path(tempdir(), "mycompendium")) } #> Creating directories ... #> my_other_compendium #> │    #> ├── data/   #> │   ├── processed/  # modified/rearranged data #> │   └── raw/  # original data #> ├── manuscript/  # manuscript/poster figures #> ├── output/  # all non-data products of data analysis #> └── scripts/  # code #> Done. #> mycompendium #> │    #> ├── data/   #> │   ├── processed/   #> │   └── raw/   #> ├── manuscript/   #> ├── output/   #> └── scripts/

what: sketchy: create custom research compendiums — sketchy
title: sketchy: create custom research compendiums — sketchy
text: `sketchy` intended facilitate use research compendiums data analysis R environment. Standard research compendiums provide easily recognizable means organizing digital materials, allowing  researchers inspect, reproduce, build upon research.

title: sketchy: create custom research compendiums — sketchy
text: main features package : Creation (customized) folder structure Simplify inclusion big data files version control software online collaborative platforms (e.g. github)

title: sketchy: create custom research compendiums — sketchy
text: Marcelo Araya-Salas, Beatriz Willink & Andrea Arriaga Maintainer: Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)
